ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: How to understand, speak, write in Portuguese. Best of all I understand the switch and distinctions between Spanish and Portuguese.
Elementary Portuguese vocabulary, geography, culture, food, etc

I learnt how about significant aspects of Portuguese and Brazilian culture such as favelas, and learnt how to discuss and analyze different forms of media in Portuguese such as children's books, short films and newspaper articles.
Learned introductory Portuguese and Brazilian culture.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Giseli is the best instructor I have had. Her dynamic engagement made the material come to life.

Professor Giseli was a highly passionate, engaging and patient instructor. Instead of learning vocabulary and grammar from a textbook, I enjoyed how the class was structured to teach us Portuguese through Brazilian media such as art gallery exhibition descriptions and the children's book "Da Minha Janela". It was highly engaging, although grammar was difficult to learn this way.
Strong course. Wonderful teacher with solid curriculum.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would highly recommend this course to any student that wants to learn Portuguese and how to discuss aspects of Brazilian culture in Portuguese.

Yes, especially if you want to focus on learning about a language and culture, instead of drowning yourself in hours of worksheets and busywork. The Portuguese department focuses on immersing its students in the language, which I find very enjoyable and efficient.
